directions: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat.  Cook mustard seeds in hot oil until they begin to crackle. Stir in ginger and onion; cook for 5 minutes. Pour in water, and stir in tamarind paste. Bring to a boil, then season with coriander, chile powder, and salt.  Reduce heat to medium-low, and cook on for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Cook fish in sauce until fish is cooked through. Serve garnished with fresh curry leaves.
ingredients: 1/2 pound cod fillets, cut into 1 inch cubes
title: Fish in Ginger-Tamarind Sauce
